installation.question: Do I need to install a package?
installation.answer: No. SapaUI is a copy-paste library. You simply copy the raw code directly into your project. No heavy dependencies or vendor lock-in.

tech_stack.question: What specific technologies are inside?
tech_stack.answer: Built on the bleeding edge: Next.js 14 (App Router), Tailwind CSS v3.4, TypeScript 5, Supabase, and specialized accessible components.

license.question: Can I sell projects I build with this?
license.answer: Absolutely. The code is yours. Build SaaS products, client websites, or internal tools and sell them unlimitedly. No royalties, no strings attached.

customization.question: Can I customize the components?
customization.answer: Yes! Since the code lives in your project, you have full control. You can modify any Tailwind class or logic to fit your specific brand.

roadmap.question: Are more components coming?
roadmap.answer: Yes! We ship new UI blocks (Dashboards, Forms, Sections) every week based on user requests. Your boilerplate grows with you.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: No installation required! SapaUI is a copy-paste component library.

items.npm: npm, yarn, or pnpm package manager

step1.title: Step 1: Find Components
step1.description: Browse our component library to find the perfect components for your project.
step1.code:
1. Go to the Components page
2. Browse by category
3. Preview components live
4. Click 'Copy Code'

step2.title: Step 2: Paste into Your Project
step2.description: Create a new component file in your Next.js project and paste the code.

installation.tipText: You can customize any component by modifying Tailwind CSS classes to match your brand colors and styling.

usage.title: Using SapaUI
usage.description: Complete guide to using SapaUI components and templates in your projects.

intro.title: Our Approach
intro.description: SapaUI does not use npm packages. We provide source code for you to own completely.

find.title: 1. Search & Find
find.description: Go to the <bold>Library</bold> section. Use sidebar categories or search to find the component you need.

copy.title: 2. Copy Code
copy.description: Click the <bold>View Code</bold> tab on any component card. Then click the copy button to grab JSX and Tailwind classes.

paste.title: 3. Paste & Import
paste.description: Paste the code into your project (e.g., <code_1>src/components/ui/MyComponent.tsx</code_1>). Update imports if necessary.

customize.title: 4. Customize
customize.description: The code is yours now! Change colors, sizes, or behavior directly in the file. No need to override complex library styles.

proTip.title: Pro Tip: Monolithic vs Molecular
proTip.description: Our templates are often provided as <bold>Monolithic Files</bold>. This means the entire landing page is loaded in one file for easy copy-paste.

steps.1: Go to the <bold>Templates</bold> tab and select a design.
steps.2: Click <bold>Copy Code</bold> to get the page structure.
steps.3: Create a new file (e.g., <code_1>src/app/marketing/page.tsx</code_1>) and paste the code.
steps.4: Customize text and images as needed.
